fields.description: *Assessment* When running euca-register to register an instance store-backed HVM image, the following error is returned: {code} # euca-register -n raring-server-20140314 raring-2014-03-15/raring-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.raw.manifest.xml --virtualization-type hvm --region admin@ euca-register: error (InternalFailure): The specified bucket does not exist. {code} fields.summary: euca-register responds with (InternalFailure): The specified bucket does not exist

comments.body:
Eucalyptus versions:

{code}
# euca-version
euca2ools 3.0.2-111-ga4adffa (Omega)
eucalyptus 4.0.0

# rpm -qa | grep eucalyptus
eucalyptus-cloud-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-imaging-worker-image-1.0.0-0.68.140313git99e7398.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-walrus-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cc-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.4-0.177.140311git5098808.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.5-0.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-release-internal-3.4-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-gl-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sc-4.0.0-0.0.690.20140306git10dbb29b.el6.x86_64
{code}

Harold, you need to set your s3_url to the OSG, not Walrus. I assume you're working as the eucalyptus/admin user. I am currently working on locking off Walrus from user-direct access.

The issue is you don't have an OSG registered, which is what the system uses for all S3 access. So, when the system tries to lookup the bucket it can't.

Steps to resolve:
* register an osg: euca_conf --register-osg
* modify your s3_url in eucarc to point to services/objectstorage
* re-upload the bundle
* register again using same command. It should work.

For the 4.0 release, the OSG itself will respond to /services/Walrus and walrus will be internal-only with a service path /services/WalrusBackend. Until that code lands, you'll need to use /services/objectstorage for any and all s3_urls you use in tools.
This configuration should not be allowed. I have a bug open and a fix nearly in place to prevent such situations and configurations.
Thanks [~zhill].  I changed performed the steps you mentioned above, and it worked as expected.
